original_title: G-Man: The Making of an FBI Agent
overview: This film takes you inside with the 40 members of a training class as they endure 16 grueling weeks in the classroom, on the weapons range, in the gym, the pool, the aforementioned Yellow Brick Road obstacle course and even the moot courtroom. Since screening for the academy is so selective, most trainees make it all the way to become FBI special agents. You'll see how they enter the program, some a bit cocky and others very wary. Midway through the program, you begin to see a change and in the last week or so, you can tell these people are ready to join the Federal Bureau of Investigation. The film features intimate access to the students in every setting, including the dorms as they process another full day. You get a sense of why, on graduation day, the members of this class feel as if they earned their diplomas and the title "special agent."
title: G-Man: The Making of an FBI Agent

overview: Features a dead mouse with ants on it.
title: Dead Mouse with Ants

overview: A pig walks.
title: The Pig Walks

overview: Matías Piñeiro's first film, produced when he was a film student.
title: A Silent Woman

overview: Jim Marrs looks at the Aurora Crash.  According to a news story that appeared in The Dallas Morning News, an "airship" crashed in Aurora Texas on April 17th, 1897. According to the news report, published two days later, the "airship" crashed into the windmill at Judge Proctor's place and the pilot -- a "Martian" -- was killed in the crash and later buried in the town cemetery. In 1897 a UFO crashed in Aurora, Texas where it hit a windmill and exploded. The remains of an alien body were recovered and buried in the local cemetery. This documentary was premiered at the first annual Aurora Alien Encounter on Saturday, April 16th, 2016 - An event to commemorate the historical incident
title: Aurora: The UFO Crash of 1897

overview: When mischievous Chadder Chipmunk mistakenly hops aboard the Collapso, a research ship headed for the coral reefs, he's in for a wild ride. Someone is stealing the coral and endagering the reef! Chadder and his new friend, Jamie, face an amazing adventure as they find out.
tagline: Who is The Coral Reef Theif?
title: Chadders Undersea Adventure

overview: Boo Boo wants to befriend a new gang of bears that moved into the park but they decide to bully him instead leaving Ranger Smith to come to the rescue.
title: Boo Boo and the Man

overview: In the mysterious jungles of Costa Rica a young girl on Spring Break runs into weird Jungle Vampires from Outer Space. It can only mean "Skin Eating Jungle Vampires." The "Witch Doctor" predicts Death for all.
title: Skin Eating Jungle Vampires

overview: The Lost Book of Abraham retells the story of Joseph Smith's amazing discovery, and investigates the veracity of his translation. This compelling documentary visits prominent Egyptologists and scholars—both Mormon and non-Mormon—in an attempt to uncover the truth about this fascinating episode in Mormon history.
tagline: Investigating a Remarkable Mormon Claim
title: The Lost Book Of Abraham

original_title: Circle of Fire: The Dark Lord Kylnor
overview: The land is being taken over by the Dark Lord Kylnor. The people need help of the elves to save them. The Circle of Power is a necklace of power and only one can retrieve it.
title: Circle of Fire: The Dark Lord Kylnor

overview: In this latest chapter of the PRISON ON FIRE saga, Fung, a gang leader sentenced to life imprisonment, gradually turns to religion. With the help of the prison's priest, Fung begins to preach to his fellow cellmates. But the toughest skeptic turns out to be his own son, who is now in the same prison.
title: Prison on Fire: Preacher

original_title: Bear in the Big Blue House LIVE! - Surprise Party
overview: It's Tutter's birthday and viewers are invited to join Bear and the gang in the Big Blue House as they work together to plan a surprise party for Tutter. This stage production features many of the voices from the show and many of its songs as well.
tagline: Join Bear live on stage for a surprise party!
title: Bear in the Big Blue House LIVE! - Surprise Party

original_title: Best of Backyard Wrestling 3: Too Shocking For TV
overview: Ventura Distribution, the company behind such series as Luke's Freakshow and Girls Gone Wild, presents this third volume in their line of uncensored wrestling programs, The Best of Backyard Wrestling. Claiming to more hardcore than its predecessors, The Best of Backyard Wrestling, Vol. 3: Too Shocking for TV features matches involving flaming baseball bats, mousetraps, cacti, and bricks wrapped in barbed wire. Released in 2002, the program also features an uncensored look at several so-called "Backyard Babes."
title: Best of Backyard Wrestling 3: Too Shocking For TV

overview: Police investigate a strange series of snakebite deaths.
title: Snake Lover

overview: A warm and humorous environmental portrait from Øksnes in Vesterålen where radio bingo is a widespread activity.
title: Radio Bingo

overview: A group of skeptical friends are faced with mysterious hauntings and repressed memories in an unfamiliar area.
title: Praise of Death

overview: Rain had a fine family, she lost everything in a murder. In order to get revenge on the man behind the murder, Rock. Rain acts as a killer with Ying's help. However, during a fight, Rain uses her body to block the killing knife for Vanessa. But Vanessa is using adopted children to sell drugs for Rock. And Rock is using those children to get Rain into the trap...
title: Killing Skill

overview: January 22, 1932. An unprecedented peasant uprising erupts in western El Salvador, as a group of Latino and indigenous peasants cut army supply lines, attack a military garrison, and take control over several towns. Retribution is swift. After three days, the army and militias move in and, in some villages, slaughter all males over age 12. Elsewhere, they summarily execute anyone suspected of having a link to the Communists. Over the next few weeks, 10,000 people are massacred.
title: 1932: Scars of Memory

overview: I travelled across Mauritania to find a tree that I saw from my window in Belgium. It wasn't a mythical tree, but rather one that could be anywhere. On my way, I met men and women who shared their perception of this quest and in doing so, in a roundabout way they shared some of their visions of the world and of existence. For some, my tree was the sign from the spirits, of the invisible or a call from light. For others, it was the symbol of a history, a culture or the end of a period in time. For yet others, it was a tree that you see only when you get lost...
title: Faraway Roots

overview: A Tom Tom Chaser is Jacobs' 2002 poetic riff on the transformation of his classic film Tom Tom the Piper's Son from chemical to electronic form during the telecine process.
title: A Tom Tom Chaser

original_title: Secret History of the Dividing Line
overview: Paired texts as dueling histories; a journey imagined and remembered; 57 mileage markers produce an equal number of prospects. The latest in a series of films about the division of landscapes, objects, people, ideas and the Byrd family of Virginia during the early 18th century. —David Gatten
title: Secret History of the Dividing Line

overview: A comedic look at the disastrous effects of sibling rivalry.
title: Love Thy Brother

original_title: Filmer le désir - Voyage à travers le cinéma de femmes
overview: The film consists largely of a series of interviews with female filmmakers from several different countries and filmmaking eras. Some, such as Agnès Varda and Catherine Breillat (both from France), have been making films for decades in a conscious effort to provide an alternative to the male filmmaking model; others, such as Moufida Tlatli (Tunisia) and Carine Adler (England), are relative newcomers to directing, and their approaches seem more personal and less political. The film as a whole manages to cover some important topics in the feminist debate about film -- how does one construct a female gaze, how can one film nude bodies without objectifying the actors (of either sex), what constitutes a strong female role -- while also making it clear that “women’s film” comprises as many different approaches to filmmaking as there are female filmmakers.
title: Filming Desire: A Journey Through Women’s Cinema

overview: Director:  Steve Buscemi
title: Baseball Wives

overview: "What if someone wrote your biography? Would there be horns and halos involved?"
title: Horns and Halos

overview: In this erotic thriller, terror reigns over paradise as a serial killer turns Hawaii's tropical beaches into a personal playground. Now, sexy detective Alexandria Jameson must stop the deranged murderer before the tide washes up the next victim.

overview: When a mysterious man named Schwaz shows up in a small town set in their ways, he starts to shake things up in this riotous family comedy.

overview: Hired delivery boy Jerry starts asking questions about the mysterious packages he's been delivering, and finds himself in the middle of a drug business.
